CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . In the context of an inheritance dispute , in DATE the applicant brought an action before the NORP ORG . On DATE the case was transferred to the NORP Pest Central District Court .
CARDINAL . On DATE the procedure was interrupted after a few hearings because the applicant did not identify the successor of CARDINAL of the respondents who had died .

CARDINAL . As of DATE , sections DATE and CARDINAL/B of the Code of Civil Procedure provided a first instance remedy and appeal for complaints about the undue length of civil proceedings . The courts dealing with such complaints , if well - founded , are expected to order measures to facilitate the progress of the litigation at issue .
